title: Drawing, "The Virgin Ascending; Virgin Ascending; Two Putti, after Domenichino; Two Feminine Figures", 1821–22
title_raw: The Virgin Ascending; Virgin Ascending; Two Putti, after Domenichino; Two Feminine Figures
medium: Pen and ink, brush and brown wash over black chalk on white wove paper
inscribed: in pen and brown ink at center left: Lodovico Carracci Bologna; at center: Albani, Bologna; at lower left: 18 Domenichino Bologna; at lower center: Domenichino Bologna
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: Upper left, the Virgin, with arms extended, born heavenwards through clouds by eight angels and cherubim. Upper right, Virgin born heavenwards, supported by four winged putti, with another angel at upper left. Lower left, two putti, one seated, and other kneeling, holding sprays of flowers. Lower right, two kneeling women, embracing.

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, "The Virgin Ascending; Virgin Ascending; Two Putti, after Domenichino; Two Feminine Figures", 1821–22. Pen and ink, brush and brown wash over black chalk on white wove paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-3563-3.
